ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Developed my Mandarin skills at an intermediate level
I made significant advancement in all four fundamental skills. (reading, listening, writing, speaking)
I better understood the Chinese culture as well as the Chinese language.
This course furthered my skills in speaking, listening, reading, and writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Basically everything - teacher, coursework, homework amount, tests Weakness: Location (Watson Center is a bit far from my dorm)

The course is exceptional. I am worried that the textbook might be out of date, and I'd prefer a textbook written by a person from mainland China. Furthermore, the "word usage section" is not usable. Fortunately, the professors make their own slides which cover this in depth, but I feel that the professors' slides would be a far better reference than the textbook!
I liked the constant upkeep of grammar structures and vocabulary. It helped build upon my understanding of the language.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it is a great class with a great teacher and great resources to help you.
Yes, without a doubt. The course is very well organized, the professors are fantastic.
I would recommend Chinese 140 to another student. I think the course does a good job in facilitating student learning and understanding of another culture.
I would recommend taking this course because it pushes you to really learn the language. There is no "cutting corners".
